description: This course is intended for those students wishing to prepare for the PlacementExam into FNCE 621. The FNCE 621 course will fulfill the core requirement in financial analysis in half a semester, instead of the usual full semester in the FNCE 601 course. Only the students with some prior knowledge of financial analysis (either by course work or by practical experience), or with some strong analytical backgrounds should consider taking this course and the Placement Exam. Together FNCE 604 and FNCE 621 form the foundation for subsequent courses in corporate finance, security analysis, investments, and speculative markets. Their purpose is to develop a framework for analyzing a firm's investment and financing decisions. FNCE 604 will provide an introduction to present value and capital budgeting techniques under certainty. The FNCE 621 course will start where FNCE 604 stops, and will cover capital budgeting techniqes under uncertainty, asset valuation, the operation and efficiency of capital markets, and the optimal capital structure of the firm
name: PREP FOR ACCEL CORP FIN

values.comments:
FNCE 604, with FNCE 621, forms the foundation for subsequent courses in corporate finance, security analysis, investments and speculative markets. The purpose of the two classes is to develop a framework for analyzing a firm's investment and financing decisions. FNCE 604 will provide an introduction to present value and capital budgeting techniques under certainty.

Overall, students felt that the class moved very quickly (not without fair warning) and that the professor did a great job of “refreshing financial knowledge.” Students appreciated the real-world application and extracurricular topics in the course.

“Excellent professor,” “clear and concise,” and “very entertaining and enthusiastic” were just a few items of praise Professor Edmands received. The main criticisms by the students were that the pace was very accelerated and his “breaks” weren’t actually breaks per se but just off topic conversations.

Students thought the material of the class was appropriate and added that the final exam was especially challenging. The textbook seemed to be much less relevant than the problem sets when it came to studying for the exam, as it focused on the application of material.
